title: The papers: Cummings claims PM lied, and energy bills warning
description: A mix of stories lead Tuesday's newspaper front pages, including the latest on the No 10 parties row.

title: Waves roared like jet engines as we rowed the Atlantic
description: The journey from Spain to the Caribbean took five East Lothian men 36 days, 3hrs and 33 minutes to complete.

title: 'Hard to be a sexy name when you are called Potter’ – but Brighton boss is attracting a lot of attention
description: Brighton boss Graham Potter says he is resigned to never being a "sexy" Premier League manager, but BBC Sport looks at why he has become one of the most admired.

title: Burnley's game with Watford on Tuesday postponed
description: Burnley's Premier League game at home against Watford on Tuesday is postponed because of a high number of players with injuries and Covid-19.

title: Japan striker Daizen scores on debut as Celtic beat Hibs
description: Daizen Maeda nets four minutes into his Scottish Premiership debut as Celtic blow away Hibernian in a pulsating first-half performance.

title: Texas synagogue siege: Rabbi describes escape from gunman
description: Charlie Cytron-Walker was one of four people taken hostage by British citizen Malik Faisal Akram.

title: Bayern Munich's Lewandowski wins Best Fifa award
description: Bayern Munich and Poland striker Robert Lewandowski is named the Best Fifa Men's Player of the Year.

title: Barcelona's Putellas wins Best Fifa award & Hayes named best coach
description: Barcelona midfielder Alexia Putellas is named the Best Fifa Women's Player of the Year.

title: Russia-Ukraine crisis: Why Brussels fears Europe is 'closest to war' in decades
description: Fears are rising over Russia's plans to shake up the region, writes BBC Europe editor Katya Adler.

title: BBC TV licence fee: What is it and why is it under threat?
description: The government has hinted that it may abolish the TV licence after 2027.

title: Tonga eruption: How its impact spread so widely and violently
description: The impact of a massive eruption in Pacific has been felt around the world.

title: Djokovic back in Serbia after Australia deportation over visa row
description: The tennis star arrives in Belgrade after being deported from Australia over his Covid vaccination status.

title: Australian Open: Why Emma Raducanu needs time and patience
description: As Emma Raducanu starts the Australian Open as tennis' newest Grand Slam women's singles champion, BBC Sport looks at why expectations must be tempered.

title: Texas synagogue siege: Teens held in UK as Briton named as hostage-taker
description: Briton Malik Faisal Akram died in the standoff with police after taking four hostages.

title: Tonga tsunami: Anxious wait for news after Tonga cut off
description: Two days on, the scale of the damage is unclear, with communications extremely limited.

title: ScotWind offshore auction raises £700m
description: Crown Estate Scotland said 17 projects have been chosen in the first seabed leasing round in a decade.

title: Boris Johnson not in danger over parties, says Nadhim Zahawi
description: As MPs return to Westminster, the education secretary denies an operation to save the PM is in place.

title: Novak Djokovic: What next for 20-time Grand Slam champion after Australia row?
description: Novak Djokovic has been deported from Australia following the row over a vaccine exemption. What happens next for the Serb?

title: Amazon halts plan to block UK Visa credit cards amid talks
description: Plans to block the cards are halted as the two sides continue to try to resolve a dispute over payment fees.

title: Channel migrants: Royal Navy set to take over English Channel operations
description: Tory MP says plans a "distraction", but government source says move allows focus on asylum reform.

title: Gracie Spinks death: Parents to take Gracie's Law petition to MPs
description: Gracie Spinks, 23, is thought to have been killed by a former colleague who stalked her.

title: Pacific volcano: British woman reported missing after Tonga tsunami
description: Friends say on social media that Angela Glover appears to have been swept away in the disaster.

title: Anne Frank betrayal suspect identified after 77 years
description: A new investigation identifies a suspect who may have told the Nazis about the Jewish diarist's hideout.

title: Credit Suisse boss Horta-Osorio resigns over Covid breaches
description: Antonio Horta-Osorio has left with immediate effect after breaking UK and Swiss quarantine rules.

title: Why satellites are key to understanding Pacific volcano
description: When the huge eruption happened over the weekend, a fleet of spacecraft overhead gathered key data.

title: British fighter 'Venom' Page to face Amosov for Bellator title in London
description: Michael 'Venom' Page will fight for the Bellator welterweight title in London against champion Yaroslav Amosov.

title: Norrie does not know why he 'didn't perform' after being outclassed by Korda at Australian Open
description: Cameron Norrie is outclassed by American rising star Sebastian Korda as Britain's bid in the Australian Open singles makes an inauspicious start.

title: 'Brady my inspiration' - Robertson chasing World titles to put him among snooker's greats
description: Masters champion Neil Robertson is using NFL legend Tom Brady as his inspiration as he tries to cement his place among snooker's greats.

title: Derby woman completes bid to run length of New Zealand
description: Emma Timmis ran all 1,300 miles (2,100km) in 20 days, 17 hours and 17 minutes.

title: The Papers: PM quizzed on parties as he battles 'to save skin'
description: Reports of measures Boris Johnson is taking in a bid to hold onto his premiership dominate Monday's papers.

title: 'Time to replace the County Championship' - Agnew's plan to save the England Test team
description: After England's latest Ashes humbling in Australia, Jonathan Agnew says the County Championship should be replaced in order to save the England Test team.

title: North Korea fires missiles again amid unusual flurry of tests
description: It has conducted four launches in two weeks - an unusual frequency for this time of the year.

title: 49ers, Chiefs & Bucs advance in play-offs as Roethlisberger career ends after defeat
description: The San Francisco 49ers hold off the Dallas Cowboys for the first upset of the NFL play-offs while the Kansas City Chiefs and Tampa Bay Buccaneers also progress.

title: London's long-term lav affair: A history of public toilets in the capital
description: From Dick Whittington's giant toilet to the urinary leash - how public loos have influenced the way we live.

title: Nigeria's economy: Why people are buying sanitary pads in packs of two
description: A so-called "sachet economy" has emerged as high inflation makes everyday items too expensive for many.

title: Ruth Davidson had mental health concerns over leader role
description: The former Scottish Tory leader said she almost did not run for leader over her mental health history.

title: Energy bills: 'It feels like I'm sleeping outside'
description: People tell of their struggles to cope, with energy bills set to soar by more than £700 this year.

title: Britain's most dangerous roads
description: Panorama investigates the roads that kill a jumbo jet's worth of people every three months.

title: How delivery apps created 'the Netflix of food ordering'
description: Innovative food delivery apps offer everything from multiple restaurant orders to home chef cuisine.

title: Covid vaccine: Your concerns answered
description: BBC Reality Check answers your vaccine concerns - from pregnancy fears to production speed.
